experience: You and Nicole C. both know Aric Zion, Scott Pletzer, and 4 others
You both studied at Northern Arizona University
Nicole C. studied at Northern Arizona University before you started

Perseverance Research Center (PRC) provides services and testing for patients who are interested in clinical procedures or research that could possibly slow down or abate disease progression. PRC offers a multi-specialty platform for the advancement of medicine and clinical research by partnering with the leading pharmaceutical companies in the nation while providing physicians the opportunity to incorporate research into their practice. The whole goal of the Center is to improve the quality of lives of those who suffer from incurable diseases. We believe PRC’s team approach is a model that provides the best comprehensive care for patients and families in an environment that values research as the best path for fostering hope for a progression-free future.  The Center also encompass a division for education. PRC partners with practicing neurologists, primary care providers, and other advanced practitioners to help provide a review of clinical medicine and progress in patient care for various  conditions. Each educational series  provides current concepts of understanding specific disorders as well as new advances in treatment.By creating such a center, this collaboration, among experienced researchers and clinicians can provide treatments that could possibly be efficacious and effective for patients with a myriad of  disorders.  This Center will bring together the best leaders in the clinical research as well as the best local providers; therefore, creating additional resources and opportunities for patients, caregivers and medical professionals.

NeuroVitality is a vitamin company for Neurological disorders.  Neuro-V, is the company's primary product people who suffer from peripheral, diabetic, or small fiber neuropathy. People with nerve damage from injuries have also benefitted from this product.
Director of Clinical Research and Operations

- Responsible for business development, sponsor relations and study acquisition; represent the company to pharmaceutical companies and CROs - Search and identify studies, develop relationship with sponsor and complete all documentation and startup procedures to bring in and start new clinical trials.- Develop budgets, maintain financial records- Plan and coordinate the initiation of each research study, oversee the development of all site-specific study documentation for CRO and SMO services.- Recruit, manage and train research support staff on protocols and study related procedures, as appropriate to the activity.- Train and supervise clinical research coordinators, regulatory staff and investigators to effectively conduct clinical trials in accordance with all applicable regulations, including but not limited to, GCP, 21 CFR 11, 21 CFR 16, 21 CFR 50, 45 CFR 46 and the Privacy Rule.- Collaborate on and establish policies and procedures; assist in writing protocols for studies. Write informed consents as necessary; review informed consent forms for accuracy and clarity.- Assist in CRF design and development and in-house monitoring of source documents, CRFs and query resolution.- Develop the strategy and execute the tactics to rapidly screen and recruit patients who may qualify for research studies.- Communicate clinical project related information effectively, including the preparation and presentation of study-related information.- Coordinate the day-to-day activities of research support staff specifically engaged in the carrying out of research/clinical protocol, as appropriate to the position; may perform aspects of research protocol, as required, in accordance with specified program objectives.- Coordinate audits of patient files and regulatory binders prior to all Sponsor/CRO Monitoring visits.

-In charge of  company's clinical department.-Designs and writes clinical trials. -Responsibilities include running clinical research program, managing several physicians, CROs, coordinators and nursing staff at multiple centers nationwide.-In charge of research financials, and contractual and budget negotiating.-Designs CRF documents, study reports and preparing and submitting documents for IRB according to all ICH/GCP guidelines. -Responsible for the execution of all feasibility medical device studies. -Overall management of investigator initiated trials from start-up to study close out. -Oversees CRAs during course of study duration.-Currently works as Company's Project Manager on three studies and Director of Research for the company.-Lead studies and provide strategic and tactical planning, organization, direction and tracking for completion of a study or series of studies within a project -Provide updates on project progress, resource needs, Sponsor issues and team member performance -Develop study plans, documents, trackers, and processes as per the scope of work -Oversee team meetings  -Monitor and manage the study timelines -Supervise study resourcing and team member changes -Present at Investigator Meetings, Monitoring Training Sessions, and other study meetings as required
Specializes in patient, physician and neurosurgeon education on vagus nerve stimulation for refractory epilepsy patients.
Doctor of Clinical Research (Ph.D) and Masters in Clinical Research (MCR)
Doctor of Clinical Research (Ph.D) and Masters in Clinical Research (MCR)

recommendations: Nathan Eskey
Senior Analyst Programmer - Core EHR at Mayo Clinic
May 25, 2011, Nicole C. and Nathan were students together

I had the honor to not only know Nathan Eskey as a fellow classmate at ASU WP Carey School of Business but to also know him on a personal level. Nathan Eskey was probably one of the most intelligent, brightest, self-efficient, diligent, intrinsically motivated people that I knew during my time in graduate school. Nathan's intelligence and his ability to communicate with every nationality and unique personality made him a favorite among our fellow classmates. He is a natural born leader and was the one person that every one relied on when they needed help in any subject. I was very fortunate to work with Nathan on several group projects and he really guided me through the rough times and gave me the confidence I needed to succeed in areas that I lacked expertise in. I would highly recommend Nathan to any job position, his innate ability to teach and lead will make anyone around him more knowledgeable, and his brilliance and creativity will make any business he works for successful.-Nicole C. Hank, MHSMDirector of  PNA Center for Neurological ResearchPresident and Owner of NeuroVitality

Sandy Wong
Web Designer and Developer
June 25, 2010, Sandy was a client of Nicole C.’s

Oikoumene Online Marketing is headed by Sandy Wong, who in my eyes is as great as they get.This company has been an absolute delight to work with on so many levels. I've been in the medical profession for over 10 years and have worked with different organizations, collaborated with hundreds of professionals and Sandy's professionalism, efficiency, creativity and brillance has definitely set the bar. I would highly recommend Oikoumene Online Marketing to anyone who wants nothing but the best!
